1.name: Intolerance: Love's Struggle Throughout the Ages
1.description: The story of a poor young woman, separated by prejudice from her husband and baby, is interwoven with tales of intolerance from throughout history.

2.name: 20,000 Leagues Under the Sea
2.description: A French professor and his daughter accompany Captain Nemo on an adventure aboard a submarine.

3.name: Sherlock Holmes
3.description: When a couple of swindlers hold young Alice Faulkner against her will in order to discover the whereabouts of letters which could spell scandal for the royal family, Sherlock Holmes is on the case.

4.name: The Blacklist
4.description: Based on the 1915 Colorado miners strike. Warren Harcourt, the coal company manager, comes to the scene. This causes a chain of events that will change the current status quo.

5.name: Where Are My Children?
5.description: A District Attorney's outspoken stand on abortion gets him in trouble with the local community.

6.name: Shoes
6.description: A young working girl must suport her family on only five dollars a week. The strain of trying to feed, house and clothe her mother, her father and three brothers finally gets to be too much...                See full summary »

7.name: The Fall of a Nation
7.description: Three acts and a prologue. Act 1: A nation falls. Act 2: The heel of the conqueror. Act 3: The uprising two years later.

8.name: A Daughter of the Gods
8.description: A sultan agrees to help an wicked witch destroy a mysterious young lady, if the witch will bring his young son back from the dead with magic.

9.name: Vingarne
9.description: An adaptation of Herman Bang's 1902 novel "Mikaël." A sculptor befriends a young painter who becomes his model. Their friendship is thrown into turmoil when they both fall in love with the same woman.

10.name: Judex
10.description: A twelve part serial following the adventures of the masked vigilante Judex as he fights against criminals led by the corrupt banker Favrauxom.

12.name: Verdens Undergang
12.description: A comet, passing by Earth, causes rioting, social unrest, and major disasters that destroy the world.

13.name: The Picture of Dorian Gray
13.description: A rake remains young while his portrait grows old.

14.name: The Cossack Whip
14.description: Feodor Turov, chief of the Russian Czar's secret police, orders his Cossacks to attack a village he believes to be infested with rebels. The Cossacks attack the village and massacre almost ...                See full summary »

15.name: Hell's Hinges
15.description: In the wayward western town known as Hell's Hinges, a local tough guy is reformed by the faith of a good woman.

16.name: The Mysteries of Myra
16.description: Myra Maynard, is plagued by a wide variety of metaphysical assaults by the corrupt Black Order, a secret organization which uses magic, curses and any supernatural means possible to achieve its ends.

17.name: The Three Godfathers
17.description: Three outlaws fleeing a posse through the desert come upon a dying woman and her baby in a wagon. Before she passes away, she makes the men promise to take care of her baby and get it safely through the desert.

18.name: The Good Bad-Man
18.description: An outlaw calling himself Passin' Through halts his "evil" ways long enough to help out some children in difficulty.

19.name: Joan the Woman
19.description: A WWI English officer is inspired the night before a dangerous mission by a vision of Joan of Arc, whose story he relives.

20.name: Lovely Mary
20.description: Mary Lane and her cousin Claiborne want to sell some land left to them by their family. Real-estate agent Roland Manning falls in love with her, and prepares a deal that will make money for...                See full summary »

21.name: The Half-Breed
21.description: An outcast named Lo Dorman encounters a young woman lost in the woods. He defends her from danger in the forest and from Sheriff Dunn.

22.name: Homunculus
22.description: A group of scientists, led by a Professor Ortmann, produce a living human child using scientific processes - a "homunculus." This creature is human in every way, except that he cannot experience love.

23.name: Pikovaya dama
23.description: While hosting a game of cards one night, Narumov tells his friends a story about his grandmother, a Countess. As a young woman, she had once incurred an enormous gambling debt, which she ...                See full summary »

24.name: The Crimson Stain Mystery
24.description: In attempting to develop a chemical which would make a person super-intelligent, Dr. Montrose fails and the subjects of his experiments metamorphose into hideous monsters who band together ...                See full summary »

25.name: The Dumb Girl of Portici
25.description: Fenella, a poor Italian girl, falls in love with a Spanish nobleman, but their affair triggers a revolution and national catastrophe.

28.name: Romeo and Juliet
28.description: Shakespeare's classic tale of ill-fated lovers whose deaths bring peace to their warring families.

29.name: Snow White
29.description: "Mirror, mirror on the wall who's the fairest of them all?" The Wicked Queen knows that the looking glass will always answer, "you are." But one day, the magic mirror has something new to ...                See full summary »

30.name: Little Mary Sunshine
30.description: Just after Bob's fiancée breaks off their engagement, he meets young Mary, whose mother has just died, and the two of them comfort each other.

33.name: Nattens barn
33.description: Violet, employed as a maid of Count Berkow, is wrongly accused of burglary of the Count. After an unjust prison sentence Violet travels to America.

34.name: The Matrimaniac
34.description: A young couple attempts to elope, with the bride's irate father in hot pursuit. The train stops briefly and the young man dashes off to find a minister, but before he can get himself and ...                See full summary »

35.name: Snow White
35.description: Snow White is a motherless princess, who arouses the jealousy and hatred of Mary Jane, her mother's former lady-in-waiting, who is the ugliest woman in the kingdom, but aspires to the ...                See full summary »

36.name: Arms and the Woman
36.description: Rozika is a Hungarian girl who can sing quite nice. She goes to the place known as the United States with her brother whose name happens to be Young Carl. Rozika marries a chap named Trevor...                See full summary »

37.name: Gloria's Romance
37.description: An adventurous young girl in Florida gets herself lost in the Everglades and finds terror and excitement, as well as the rivalry of two men in love with her.

38.name: The Habit of Happiness
38.description: Sunny Wiggins is convinced that laughter can cure any ailment. He tries his thesis out on a dyspeptic millionaire, to great success. He turns his attention to easing the plight of the ...                See full summary »

39.name: The Eternal Sappho
39.description: From Alphonse Daudet's 1884 novel comes a variation: A scheme by a beautiful vamp to marry a wealthy young man fails, and the woman returns to her former lover, a sculptor. She is shocked ...                See full summary »

40.name: Hævnens Nat
40.description: A criminal escapes from prison, however a betrayal leads to his second arrest.

41.name: Qristine
41.description: Destiny of a poor unhappy woman in pre-revolutional Georgia.

42.name: The Americano
42.description: Doug is an American mining engineer. Pres. Valdez of Paragonia (Aitken) wants him to reopen the country's mines. Doug is not interested ... until he sees the President's beautiful daughter,...                See full summary »

43.name: Gretchen the Greenhorn
43.description: A kindly Dutch immigrant and her bumbling father are blackmailed by a gang of counterfeiters.

44.name: Macbeth
44.description: Shakespeare's tragedy of the Scots nobleman whose ambition leads him to betrayal, murder, and damnation.

45.name: Friday the 13th
45.description: When a judge is financially ruined by Peter Brownley, a Wall Street millionaire, his daughter seeks revenge by getting a job in the tycoon's office. She manages to discover information that...                See full summary »

46.name: Balettprimadonnan
46.description: The musician Wolo is in love with the beautiful peasant girl Anjuta. She is forced, by her stepmother who runs a speakeasy, to dance for the drunken guests of the tavern.

47.name: Das Phantom der Oper
47.description: In Paris in the 1880s, the beautiful opera singer, Christine, is captured and held against her will by the infamous "phantom of the opera".

48.name: Beatrice Fairfax
48.description: Serial in 15 parts about a female crime-fighting reporter.

49.name: The Fatal Glass of Beer
49.description: An ex-convict reunites with his father.

50.name: The Aryan
50.description: Steve Denton, rich from years of prospecting, is fleeced by the citizens of Yellow Ridge. In his rage, he kidnaps the woman most responsible and makes her his slave in a desert hideaway. He...                See full summary »
